ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned a lot of Italian grammar and I got a lot better at speaking Italian.
I learned many more nuances of the language that can help elevate my speaking and understanding closer to the level of a native speaker than simply a student learning from a textbook.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths was that the class was extremely well organized and put the onus on the student to either work hard and do well or the opposite which I liked. There was a lot of responsibility to keep up with the material.
Huge strength is all the speaking practice you get in class.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Most definitely. The Italian department finds the perfect balance of having fun while also learning an immense amount.
Absolutely! The syllabus and learning environment was a great balance of activities and discussion that made the course interesting each day.
Highly recommend. Fun language to learn and the teachers are great.
Yes! L4 Italian is a great way to cement your Italian skills.
